result.execSummary:
The defendant Perry H. Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Perry H. Bell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Perry H. Bell was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to Count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Deft fined $50 plus costs.  30 DTP.  Bond to apply.  Balance due in 30 days.  In default, 2 days work crew or 2 days KCJ.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  JS adjourned to 7/20/15 @ 9am due to another case going to trial.  NOTE - deft comes from Florida.  Atty Henry does not object to picking the jury on Monday and commencing the trial immediately following jury selection.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Henry.  Due to another case going to trial, this case adjourned to 4/27/15 @ 9am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Chavez.  State moves for an adjournment; awaiting DNA test results.  No objection from defense.  FPT adj to 2/5/15 @ 10:40am, JS 2/23/15 @ 9am.

No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: MHerr.

to Preliminary Hearing

120 p.m.  ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clk:  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 5/16/14 @ 830 A.M. with Co deft.   Continued posted bond.
